quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Father and Turner Field
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, atlanta, richardson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which famous person, who received the Kennedy Center Honors in 2000, was born in St. Louis, Missouri?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Berry

questions.question: How many teams in the National Football League (NFL) are named for animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14

questions.question: Richard Steven Valenzuela, Jiles Perry Richardson, and Charles Hardin Holley are all better known by different professional names. What else do they have in common?

options.text: They were all, at different times, married to the same woman.
They died together in a plane crash.
They have all won Academy Awards.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They died together in a plane crash.

questions.question: This Hungarian-born American nuclear physicist, called the father of the hydrogen bomb, was a member of the Manhattan Project .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward Teller

questions.question: Leonardo da Vinci is well known as the artist who painted the Mona Lisa, but he was also an inventor.  Which modern-day machine is based on one of his concepts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: helicopter

questions.question: Name the original drummer for the Beatles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Best

questions.question: In the 1970s television sitcom All in the Family, what was the nickname by which Archie called Gloria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Girl

questions.question: This famous head American football coach at Florida A  M College, used to say: I like my boys to be agile, mobile, and hostile.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jake Gaither

questions.question: In 1997 the Atlanta Braves baseball team started playing its home games at Turner Field. What was Turner Field used for before it was a baseball stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Track and Field

questions.question: During the Spanish-American War, what US general commanded a division that led the main attack on San Juan Hill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacob Kent

questions.question: What was the name of the US Army Air Force B-29 bomber, that dropped the atomic bomb on Nagasaki, Japan on August 9, 1945?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bocks Car

questions.question: This word is a collective noun, which means a group of ferrets.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fesnyng

questions.question: When was the 27the amendment to the U.S. Constitution ratified?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1992

questions.question: Which country gave the Statue of Liberty to the United States as a centennial gift?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Which state was the first to ratify the Constitution of the United States in 1787?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Delaware

questions.question: Which is the only state whose legal system is not based upon English Common Law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louisiana

questions.question: In the United States Navy, what is the next rank above Ensign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lieutenant (junior grade)

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President born in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Buren

questions.question: In the 1994-2004 television sitcom Friends, which two characters were siblings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monica and Ross

questions.question: Which group of ancient people used a system of strings and knots rather than words, to record their history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Incas

questions.question: Which man originated the sentence Go west young man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Soule

questions.question: In computer jargon, what is FTP?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a way to transfer files

questions.question: What is the name of Toyotas first widely available gas-electric hybrid car?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prius

questions.question: Who was the 39th President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: What rock musicians real name is Gordon Matthew Thomas Sumner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stings

questions.question: What is the official name of Rhode Island, the 13th US state?

options.text: The State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations
The Commonwealth of Rhode Island and Narragansett Bay
The State of Rhode Island and Narragansett Bay

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations

questions.question: Which Broadway play is based on Christopher Isherwoods book, I am a camera?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabaret

questions.question: Which of the following astronauts was not among the first human beings to orbit the moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Young

questions.question: Which late-night television host is famous for his amusing Top Ten lists?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Letterman

questions.question: At what time does Big Ben, in London, have both clock hands together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Never

options.text: Build an underground, electrically heated home
Set up the millionth telephone in Britain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: TV

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taino

options.text: The last of Maos supporters to be killed.
First Asian to win a Nobel Prize.
The first man to win a Pulitzer Prize and a Nobel Prize.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The last Emperor of China.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosh Ha-Shanah

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Movie

questions.question: What was the real name of renowned folk artist, Grandma Moses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Mary Robertson

questions.question: Where would one find The Bridge of Eggs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lima , Peru

questions.question: Which one of Dr. Seusss famous characters said Save the Trees !!! Let em Grow ! ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Lorax

questions.question: Napoleon Dynamite had a favorite animal that he liked to draw.  What was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a liger (tiger and lion mix)

questions.question: Who was the first US President with no middle name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: Of what country is the kiwi bird a national symbol?  It is also native to that country.

questions.question: In the Waynes World movie, from where is Wayne and Garths live cable-access show broadcast?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waynes basement

questions.question: How do you say apple in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: manzana

questions.question: At what event was the opera Aida premiered?

options.text: The opening of the Suez Canal
The opening of La Scala in Milan
The opening of  the Panama Canal
The  opening of the National Opera House in Rome

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The opening of the Suez Canal

questions.question: In the instant messaging system (or IM), what do the letters SYS mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: see you soon

questions.question: Exactly one of these statements is true. Which one is true ?

options.text: Acids have a pH greater than 6.
Chickens do not have to be impregnated to lay eggs.
Pure water has a pH of exactly 1

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chickens do not have to be impregnated to lay eggs.

questions.question: New York City is divided into 5 boroughs. One of these is not part of NYC?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yonkers

questions.question: If you were a baker, what would you be called in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: panadero

questions.question: Name the popular song from 1993 that was featured in the beginning of the movie Benny and Joon .  The video for this song also played at the end of the movie.

options.text: Dancing with Myself  by Billy Idol
We Are Family by Sister Sledge
Im Gonna Be (500 miles) by the Proclaimers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im Gonna Be (500 miles) by the Proclaimers

questions.question: How many bones make up the backbone of a human baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 33

questions.question: What were the names of the twin sons of Jesse and Becky from the Full House TV show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alex and Nicky

questions.question: What four words end the first two lines of this famous Christmas poem ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: not even a mouse.

questions.question: In English medieval castles and houses, what room was usually called solar room?

options.text: A room where food was stored
A room where the family gathered for dinner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A room for solitary activities

questions.question: Name the two pets that Chandler Bing and Joey Tribbiani had when they roomed together on the Friends TV show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a chicken and a duck

questions.question: If you say that you would like the eggs sunny side up, what does that mean?

options.text: The yolk is liquid, the eggs are cooked on both sides
The eggs are mixed with cream
The yolk is liquid, the eggs are cooked only on one side
The yolk is hard, the eggs are cooked on both sides

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The yolk is liquid, the eggs are cooked only on one side

questions.question: In the movie What About Bob?, what does Bob have around his neck when he is riding the bus to Lake Winnipesaukee in New Hampshire ?

options.text: his goldfish Gil in a jar
some garlic cloves in a bottle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his goldfish Gil in a jar

questions.question: According to the religion of Sikhism, it is every Sikhs duty to defeat what five vices?

options.text: Religious zealots, political zealots, money lending, sexual allurement and gluttony
Alcohol, pork, money, gold, and diamonds
Ego, anger, greed, attachment, and lust
Drunkenness, lewdness, murder, rape and theft

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ego, anger, greed, attachment, and lust
